availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Dejarnett and Elizabeth Dejarnett. Married to Sarah Williams Dejarnett on July 20, 1848 in Madison County. Father of Samuel W. Dejarnett, Pattie Dejarnett, Mary E. Dejarnett, Ann V. Dejarnett, Nannie B. Dejarnett, and Emma Dejarnett. Farmer in Madison County in 1850. Owned six enslaved people in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 202B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 477.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision 2, p. 463B.

Find A Grave, "George Dejarnett (1816-1885)," Memorial #38386009, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38386009 (accessed March 18, 2020).
